page.title: 16TOWPATH WALK CONTINUED
page.content: BRIDGE 18 CARRIES A FOOTPATH WHICH LEADS FROM SCHOOL LANE TO WENLOCK BANK. JUST BEYOND THE BRIDGE THERE IS A STILE WHICH GIVES EASY ACCESS TO THE TOP OF THE BRIDGE. THE CANAL NOW ENTERS LAPLEY WOOD.IN SPRING AND SUMMER THERE ARE MANY SPECIES OF WILD FLOWERS.ABOUT 45 METRES INTO THE TREES,ON THE TOWPATH SIDE,LOOK OUT FOR A LARGE BADGER SET ON THE BANK ABOVE YOU.THIS STRETCH OF CANAL IS THE HIGHEST SECTION.WATER TO KEEP THE LEVEL UP COMES FROM BELVIDE RESERVOIR. NEXT WE PASS SAYARDS FARM WHICH IS JUST HIDDEN BY THE TREES.IT LIES BESIDE AN ANCIENT TRACK WHICH RUNS TOWARDS LAPLEY CHURCH AND WAS USED IN MEDIEVAL TIMES BY THE MONKS.THE MONKS WALK CROSSES BRIDGE 17 AND LEADS TOWARDS WATLING STREET AND ON TOWARDS THE WHITE LADIES PRIORY AT BISHOPS WOOD.
